newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Six Singaporeans hanged for drug trafficking.
newsitem.headline: Six Singaporeans hanged for drug trafficking.

text.p: Six Singaporeans were hanged on Friday for drug trafficking, the prisons department said.
One of those executed was of Indian descent, another of Malay descent and the rest of Chinese, an official said. No further details were available.
Four people were hanged in Singapore on the previous Friday for drug trafficking.

Singapore's tough drug laws include a mandatory death sentence for anyone over 18 years of age found guilty of trafficking in more than 15 grams (half an ounce) of heroin, 30 grams (an ounce) of morphine or 500 grams (18 oz) of cannabis.
Of the nearly 280 people hanged for various crimes in Singapore since 1975, over half have been for drug-related offences.
